thread.title: Dirty Projectors Release New Self-Titled Album: Listen | Pitchfork
thread.title_full: Dirty Projectors Release New Self-Titled Album: Listen | Pitchfork

title: Dirty Projectors Release New Self-Titled Album: Listen | Pitchfork
text:
Dirty Projectors Release New Self-Titled Album: Listen The vinyl is out a few days early, and spinning on the band’s Facebook Dirty Projectors Photo by Jason Frank Rothenberg 
Dirty Projectors have released their new self-titled album, Dirty Projectors , three days ahead of schedule. In a tweet, David Longstreth said, “Been 4 years, 7 months & 11 days— long enough! 3 days early, preorders are in the mail & the album in stores. Dirty Projectors is out today.” While the album will not hit digital platforms until later today, a playthrough of the album’s vinyl is being live streamed on the Dirty Projectors Facebook page. Check that out below. Longstreth previously released videos for singles “ Cool Your Heart ,” “ Little Bubble ,” and “ Keep Your Name .” 
Longstreth celebrated the album’s release by hand-delivering it to a super-fan named Rozette earlier today. According to a rep for the band, she was chosen from the pre-orders; find a photo of her and Longstreth below.
